summary: We testified about gaps in federal data for the U.S. territories—American Samoa, the Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands, Guam, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands. At each agency we reviewed, most statistical reports excluded at least one of the territories. Data gaps can limit the government's understanding of territory needs and how to best distribute resources. A mix of cost...
title: U.S. Territories: Coordinated Federal Approach Needed to Better Address Data Gaps
